briefTitle: The EVARREST® Paediatric Mild/Moderate Liver and Soft Tissue Bleeding Study

outcomeMeasures.title: Absolute Time to Haemostasis (TTH)
outcomeMeasures.description: Absolute TTH, defined as the absolute time elapsed from randomization to the last moment in time at which detectable bleeding at the target bleeding site (TBS) was observed.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Haemostatic Success at 4 Minutes Following Randomization With No Bleeding Requiring Treatment at the Target Bleeding Site Occurring Any Time Prior to Final Fascial Closure
outcomeMeasures.description: Percentage of participants achieving haemostatic success at 4 minutes following randomization with no bleeding requiring treatment at the TBS occurring any time prior to final fascial closure were reported.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Haemostatic Success at 10 Minutes Following Randomization With No Bleeding Requiring Treatment at the Target Bleeding Site Occurring Any Time Prior to Final Fascial Closure
outcomeMeasures.description: Percentage of participants achieving haemostatic success at 10 minutes following randomization with no bleeding requiring treatment at the TBS occurring any time prior to final fascial closure were reported.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With No Re-bleeding at the Target Bleeding Site
outcomeMeasures.description: Percentage of participants with no re-bleeding at the TBS were reported.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) That Were Potentially Related To Bleeding at the TBS
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of participants With AEs that were potentially related to bleeding at the TBS were reported. An AE is any untoward medical event that occurs in a participant administered an investigational product, and it does not necessarily indicate only events with clear causal relationship with the relevant investigational product.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With AEs That Were Potentially Related To Thrombotic Events
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of participants with AEs that were potentially related to thrombotic events (sponsor assessment) were reported. An AE is any untoward medical event that occurs in a participant administered an investigational product, and it does not necessarily indicate only events with clear causal relationship with the relevant investigational product.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants Who Required Re-treatment At The Target Bleeding Site
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of participants who required re-treatment at the TBS were reported.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events
outcomeMeasures.description: An AE is any untoward medical event that occurs in a participant administered an investigational product, and it does not necessarily indicate only events with clear causal relationship with the relevant investigational product.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline to Post-surgery in Haemoglobin
outcomeMeasures.description: Change from baseline to post-surgery in haemoglobin were reported.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline to Post-surgery in Haematocrit
outcomeMeasures.description: Change from baseline to post-surgery in Haematocrit was reported.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline to Post-surgery in Platelet Count
outcomeMeasures.description: Change from baseline to post-surgery in platelet count was reported.

outcomeMeasures.title: Estimated Volume of Blood Loss
outcomeMeasures.description: Estimated volume of intra-operative blood loss (including but not limited to the TBS) was reported.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants Who Received Blood Transfusions
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of participants who received blood transfusions (red blood cells \[RBCs\], whole blood, fresh frozen plasma, platelets, and cryoprecipitates) were reported.

outcomeMeasures.title: Absolute Time to Haemostasis (TTH) by Age Group
outcomeMeasures.description: Absolute TTH, defined as the absolute time elapsed from randomization to the last moment in time at which detectable bleeding at the TBS was observed.
